resources.string: Press and hold \'EMERGENCY\' button to send for help or click the \'Get Help\' button for more options.

What can I do: 
 * Stay calm by taking deep, slow breaths 
 * Maintain eye contact 
 * Be courteous and patient 
 * Maintain a calm, quiet tone of voice 
 * Signal a coworker or supervisor that you need help 
 * Have someone call security personnel 
 * Avoid statements and/or behaviors that could escalate 
 the individual's threatening statements/behavior

How do I know: 
 * Someone is being followed 
 * You see a person with a weapon 
 * You see/hear people having a heated argument 
 * You see a person who is very twitchy or on-edge
Responsibilities: Deals with crisis management situations in the hall. Assists students in fire and/or safety evacuations and provides support and referral to students in crisis.

What can I do: 
 * Stay calm 
 * Signal a coworker or supervisor, in a discreet manner, of what you have seen 
 * Have someone call security personnel 
 * Avoid behaviors that could escalate make the individual use the weapon 
 * Do not get too close to the armed individual 
 * Do not be a hero!

How do I know: 
 * Someone is wearing baggy clothes not fit for the season 
 * The person is constantly touching and adjusting something under their clothes 
 * Their jacket or overcoat sags too much on one side (due to gun weight) 
 * You see a person who is very twitchy or on-edge 
 * Distinct lump seen on the clothes 
 * Asymmetrical gait: short arm and leg swing on gun side
